newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - LE MONDE - FRANCE - April 25.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - LE MONDE - FRANCE - April 25.

text.p: These are leading stories in afternoon daily Le Monde.
-- Left-wing politicians bet on French people's desire for change, while the conservative ruling coalition denounces the "archaism" of their opponents' proposals.
-- European commission seeks to tighten controls on state help to industrial firms to prevent competition distortions.

-- Pilots at former Air Inter on strike over reform of their pay and working conditions in a merger with parent company Air France, strikes action continues at state rail company SNCF and airlines TAT and Air Liberte.

-- Campaign for parliamentary election seems to have little impact on French financial markets, the franc has not yet been subject to speculative attacks, but Socialist party platform and their position on the European single currency may raise worries.
-- Suez to sell to Commercial Union most of its stake in life-insurer Societe d'Epargne Viagere, for some 600 million francs in cash.
